question: has the highest overall average elevation
answer_text: With an average elevation of 6,800 ft above sea level, Colorado is almost 3x higher than the US average (2,500 ft).  That's a lot of Rocky Mountains...
norm_suffix: % of the US average per state.

question: has the most foreign-born residents
answer_text: More than one out of four residents of California (27%) are foreign born -- almost 10.5 million total!  Xenophobic? Try West Virginia: Less than 2% foreigners.

question: has experienced the most natural disasters
answer_text: Since 1953, Texas has endured 254 natural disasters, which is nearly 8% of the US total over that period.  Safer harbors?  Try Delaware: Only 21 disasters since 1953.
raw_prefix: There have been a total of
norm_suffix: % of the US total during that period.

question: has the highest population density
answer_text: New Jersey is our most crowded state, cramming nearly 9 million people into just 7,354 square miles.  Wide open spaces?  Try Wyoming: only 6 people / sq. mi.

question: has the highest average pay for teachers
answer_text: Teachers in New York make just under $80,000 a year on average -- that's 30% over the national average.  Teachers in South Dakota make 30% below the average.

question: has the most colleges & universities per capita
answer_text: Vermont has the highest density of colleges & universities, with 1 college for every 28,300 residents (22 total).  Texas has the most colleges overall with 299.

question: has the highest per capita prison incarceration
answer_text: Yikes! 1 out of every 100 people in Oklahoma is incarcerated.  But Texas has the most prisoners overall with 218,500 and Vermont has the least with just 1,700.

question: has the highest average family size
answer_text: The average household size in Utah is 3.35 people.  So that would be Mom, Dad, Kid and...maybe a labradoodle?  Vermont has the smallest family size at 2.4 people.

question: has the highest concentration of woman-owned businesses
answer_text: Over 40% of all businesses in Georgia are woman-owned, while only 29% of businesses in South Dakota are, which ranks them last.  The national average is 34%.
norm_suffix: % of all businesses in the state.

question: has the most children
answer_text: Nearly 30% of Utah's residents are under the age of 18 (and less than 12% are over 65).  Maybe the Great Salt Lake is some sort of fountain of youth?
raw_suffix: residents in the state under the age of 18,

question: has the most residents over the age of 64
answer_text: Despite Florida's reputation as a retirement haven, Maine is actually our "oldest" state with 20.6% of their residents 65 or older.  But Florida is close with 20.5%.
raw_suffix: residents in the state over the age of 64,

question: is the most ethnically diverse
answer_text: Over 63% of California's residents identify as non-white, just eking out New Mexico in 2nd place with 62.9%.  Conversely, only 7% of Maine identifies as non-white.

question: produces the most energy
answer_text: Pumping 5.4M barrels of crude oil up from Mother Earth each day, it's no surprise that Texas is tops on this list.  It produces over 21% of the US total energy output.
raw_suffix: trillion BTUs worth of energy every year,

question: consumes the most energy per capita
answer_text: Louisianans consume 960 million BTUs of energy per person per year.  That's enough energy to drive a Toyota Camry completely around the equator...10 times!
raw_suffix: billion gallons of gasoline every year,

question: has the highest average annual precipitation
answer_text: Over 5 feet of rain falls on Louisiana every year.  That's equal to twice the combined volumes of Lake Powell, Lake Tahoe & the Great Salt Lake...every year!
raw_suffix: inches of rain fall on the state annually,
norm_suffix: % of the US average precipitation per state.

question: lays the most chicken eggs
answer_text: Hens in Iowa are busy laying over 17 billion eggs every year.  That's enough to give every person in the US one egg a week for an entire year...just from Iowa!
raw_suffix: chicken eggs laid in the state every year,
norm_suffix: % of the total US egg production.

question: has the most farms per capita
answer_text: There is one farm in North Dakota for every 29 residents.  Those North Dakotans must all be farmers!  Not so much in Massachusetts, with 1 farm per 965 people.

question: is covered with the most farmland
answer_text: Over 90% of Nebraska's land is farmland! Maine has the least amount of farmland at only 6.5%. And Wyoming has the largest average farm size at over 2,400 acres.

question: has the most total acreage of National Park Service  land
answer_text: California's National Parks, Memorials, Historical Sites, Monuments, Preserves and Recreation Areas add up to over 27% of the US total of National Park Service land.
raw_suffix: acres of National Park Service land,

question: has the most acreage of National Parks
answer_text: Nearly 32% of all National Parks acreage is located in California, three times more than the 2nd place state, Wyoming.  There are 20 states that have no National Parks.

question: has the most acreage of National Monuments
answer_text: Nearly half a million acres of National Monument land in Arizona accounts for over 40% of the US total.  There are 21 states that have no National Monuments.

question: has the most acreage of National Historic Sites
answer_text: Almost 1/5 of the total US acreage of National Historic Sites is located in New Mexico, most of which is in the Chaco Culture National Historic Park, the nation's largest.

question: has the most farms
answer_text: The 247,000 farms in Texas account for over 12% of all the farms in the US.  Most of these 'farms' are actually cattle ranches, as beef is big in the Lone Star State.

question: has the most total miles of caves & caverns
answer_text: Kentucky has over 1,330 miles of caves -- including 412 in Mammoth Cave NP -- which if lined up end to end would stretch the length of I-5 from Mexico to Canada!

question: has the longest average commute time
answer_text: It takes over 33 minutes for the average New Yorker to commute to work everyday, each way.  Over their lifetime they'll spend more then 1.5 years stuck in traffic!

question: has the most college educated residents
answer_text: An impressive 43% of Bay Staters have earned at least a Bachelor's Degree, more than double the rate in the least educated state -- West Virginia (20%).

question: has the highest concentration of bridges
answer_text: With almost one bridge for every sq. mi of land, New Jersey's roads are full of bridges!  Gephyrophobic?  Try Nevada: Only 1 bridge every 56 sq. miles.

question: has the highest percentage of unsafe bridges
answer_text: Almost 1 out of every 4 bridges in Rhode Island has been deemed structurally unsound (23.3%).  It's a great road trip state for thrill seekers and daredevils...
norm_suffix: % of all bridges in the state.

question: is the most actively religious
answer_text: Over 63% of Alabama's residents are actively religious, defined as those who pray at least once per day and/or attend church services at least once per week.

question: has the largest acreage burned in wildfires
answer_text: 1,869 wildfires burned 385,000 acres of land in Arizona in 2019, which is 0.53% of the total state land area (tied with Idaho for the highest percent in the US).

question: has the most horses per capita
answer_text: Wyoming's nearly 58,000 horses works out to 1 for every 10 people.  In Massachusetts,  2200 people would have to share each horse.  Long lines at the pony rides...

question: has the most vacation home rentals
answer_text: Over 16% of all properties in Maine are available as vacation rentals!  Good luck finding a rental in Illinois though, where less than 1% of properties are vacation homes.
norm_suffix: % of all the properties in the state.

question: has the most water area (lakes & shorelines)
answer_text: Due mostly to calling "halvesies" on three of the Great Lakes, Michigan tops this list with over 40,000 sq. mi of water area, which is over 40% of its total state area.

answer_text: Near the top of the list in both violent and property crimes (600 & 3550 per 100K population, respectively), New Mexico easily takes the lead in overall crime rate.

question: has the largest average house size (sq. ft)
answer_text: With a whopping average size of over 2300 sq. ft, Utah does love themselves some big houses.  I guess it isn't true that everything is bigger in Texas!

question: has the highest average annual snowfall

question: has the most zoos & aquaria per capita
answer_text: Despite Florida's impressive 51 total, South Dakota actually has the most zoos & aquaria per capita, with 1 for every 110,000 residents (Florida is 1 per 420,000 people).

question: is the coldest
answer_text: With an average annual low temperature across the state of only 29 degrees, Wyoming is our chilliest state!  Frigophobic?  Try Florida: a warm and cozy 61 degrees.

question: is the warmest
answer_text: With an average annual high temperature across the state of almost 82 degrees, Florida is our warmest state.  Thermophobic? Try North Dakota: a chilly 52 degrees!
